column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Verosmom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First day that I used it I became very confused. 2nd Day my brain felt like it was numb. 3rd and last final day I woke up with blurred vision. Wanted to try this because I had been taking premarin since 2005 every 3 days, I didn't like the weight gain. Will stick with Premarin

column2: Pamela, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had a Hyst. many years ago, due to the FDA pulling all the HRT therapy drugs my doctor suggested Elestrin.  A week after using one pump per day my hair starting falling out in handfulls, general feeling of ill, and skin rash.  I have stopped this treatment!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The only complaint I have is I am losing hair. Possibly going to stop medication because of this side effect.

column2: jnn39553, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was having really bad headaches and hotflashes and I am not going thru menopause so i do  one pump have not had a headache in a week!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: kim, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After my surgery I went into full menopause. My Dr. recommended this treatment, and since my hot flashes have almost completely diminished and my headaches that I have had for years has been life changing, so far this has been an effective treatment and my mood swings have improved as well..

column2: Andie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been using this product for more than two weeks and it has helped. I was on the patch for a year and it was a pain to stay applied.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Leslie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Using Elestrin gel 2 pumps daily. Fantastic!! No mood swings, no hotflashes, no dryness or pain. Be sure to wait 2 hours after using before showering or bathing.5 min after using to dress. Use same time every day.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just had my ovaries removes via Laprascopic surgery last 6 days ago. I am 31. The first 3-4 have been emotionally crazy. However I am sure I am not balanced out yet.Hopefully each day will get better. The past two days what I have noticed is that my mood seems to fluctuate throughout the day. I use it in the morning and evening.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Fe, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: No real issues with this med... One issue I noticed the skin on my arms where I apply the gel have darkened. That is the only concern I have.

column2: terri, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been using elestrin for 2 weeks.  I was given permission by my np to use up to 3 doses a day as my fsh was very high, and she said I had practically no estrogen in my body at all.  My symptoms included hot flashes, vaginal pain and dryness, anxiety, mood swings, etc.  The hot flashes have been minimized, and I was able to have intercourse with my husband without pain for the first time in months.  I am not sure how many of the other symptoms could be expected to lessen with estrogen treatment, but the anxiety has been much more mild also, along with the mood swings.  I do not feel well yet, and maybe I am expecting too much.  My np said the next step would be an antidepressant along with the estrogen.  I tried prozac and the side effects were horrendous (I did become suicidal, it was so bad) so I am very reluctant to try another SSRI.  I spend a lot of time praying for guidance and healing as I don't think I want to take any more medications if I can possibly help it.  I have had nausea problems and weight loss but I think that happened as consequence of the prozac not the elestrin.  I think I am suffering some amount of depression from some pretty severe stress in our family so I don't know how much I can expect to be relieved.
